meanings.definition: The quality or state of being transparent.
meanings.sent1: The transparency of the glass allowed us to see through it clearly.
meanings.sent2: The transparency of the water made it easy to spot the fish swimming below.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the transparency of the glass to surprise the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her honesty was like a window of transparency, revealing her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The transparency of the ice made it look like a crystal-clear mirror.

meanings.definition: The quality of being easily understood or seen through.
meanings.sent1: The transparency of the instructions made it simple to follow the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The transparency of his explanation helped us grasp the concept quickly.
meanings.sent3: The transparency of the situation made it feel like a puzzle with all the pieces laid out.
meanings.sent4: Her intentions were as clear as the transparency of a clean window.
meanings.sent5: The transparency of the map made it easy to navigate through the city.

meanings.definition: The quality of being open and honest.
meanings.sent1: Her transparency in sharing her feelings created a strong bond between them.
meanings.sent2: The transparency of his apology showed his sincerity and regret.
meanings.sent3: The transparency of the confession brought relief to everyone involved.
meanings.sent4: His transparency in admitting his mistake was admirable and refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The transparency of their communication built trust and understanding in the team.
